intro: Knautia sylvatica var. tergestina, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
